intro: Myosotis virginica, commonly known as the Virginia forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate blue or violet flowers with white centers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has heart-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in early summer. Myosotis virginica is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also valued in ecological restoration projects.
